intro: Lepisia, commonly known as the false lichen, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Lepidobotryaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, clustered growth habit and their ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The genus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
